solution_line_template: If the two men each bought {apples_per_man} apples, together they bought {num_men}*{apples_per_man} = <<{num_men}*{apples_per_man}={apples_men}>>{apples_men} apples.

Since the two men each bought {apples_per_man} apples, {less_than_woman} less than the total number of apples bought by each woman, each woman bought {less_than_woman}+{apples_per_man} = <<{less_than_woman}+{apples_per_man}={apples_per_woman}>>{apples_per_woman} apples.
The total number of apples bought by the women is {num_women}*{apples_per_woman} = <<{num_women}*{apples_per_woman}={apples_women}>>{apples_women}
Altogether, the two men and three women bought {apples_men}+{apples_women} = <<{apples_men}+{apples_women}={total_apples}>>{total_apples} apples.
